docs.text: We met Tomas, Guillem and Laura. The other faculty were introduced via Zoom.

docs.title: Reflection
docs.text:
Work in progress…

To do: type this out properly

  • never had a philosophy class as deep/intense before
  • lots of new terminologies to google, and looks like there are many more to come
  • the structure of having different seminars and schedules every week is new to me, might be tricky to remember
  • calendar looks packed, (i’m hoping i can still find part-time job)
  • really exciting days ahead

docs.title: u .git a problem?
docs.text:
let’s try to fix that

here i’ll document the issues that i’ve encountered in setting up this website

to troubleshoot, first try git status

if you get this error 

fatal: not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git

that means that you have not created or cloned a repository properly, or not inside the correct folder check the file explorer and look for the “root” folder - this is the topmost folder of your local copy of the repository -

docs.title: git not found
docs.text:
if you try any commannd (e.g. ‘git status’) and get this error 

git : The term 'git' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was 
included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
the easiest solution is to re-install git

docs.title: git Cheat Sheet
docs.text:
these are the commands you need first for setting up: 

git init
git clone

for making updates: 

git pull
git add .
git commit -m "i will describe my changes in this commit message"
git push

here’s a handy pdf i found

docs.title: My page is up but the contents are not formatted
docs.text: probably the .html, .css, and .js files are not generated correctly

docs.title: How to embed a .pdf
docs.text:
in any part of a markdown file (a file in .md), we can insert html code the cheat sheet above looks like this in my code: 

<iframe width="100%" height="800" src="https://education.github.com/git-cheat-sheet-education.pdf"></iframe>

docs.title: How to add a new line
docs.text:
with html: 

<br>

or add this to mkdocs.yml, under the markdown_extensions: 

  - pymdownx.escapeall:
        hardbreak: true

docs.title: Atlas of Weak Signals
docs.text:
For most of us, the term as well as the concept are new. I first interpreted each of the words as I understood them.

“Atlas” is mapping/cartography tool. It sounds cooler than “map”.

Coming from engineering, “signals” for me are more common as electronic signals. Interpreting a signal as “weak” is like fuzziness. Something that is there but unclear and perhaps hard to distinguish from others. They may also be hard to trace to the source

I also kind of visualise it at catching some unknown or mixed frequency on the car radio, where you kind of have to fine tune the knob and/or physically navigate to get stronger signal.

The work begins in looking for these weak signals from possible emergent futures.

docs.title: Design Space
docs.text:
I am unsure but it looks like Design space contains AoWS and AoWS contains the weak signals

the ELIF: the Design Space AoWS is a mind map (?)

docs.title: AoWS Group Activities
docs.text: The first activity is involved the entire class running the “game” for the first time.

docs.title: Design Sprint
docs.text:
During my undergrad, my friend and I created a card game similar to this one. It was called “Design Sprint”. Ours was focused on current and more localized context (“stronger signals”?), while the AoWS cards are more general and conceptual.

2019. Design Sprint Prototype

2019. Playtesting
